price_step.description:
The price increment at which orders are aggregated. 
Can not be less then price precision of contract, and more then price precision multiplied by 100'000.
price_step.name: price_step

side.description: Specifies which side of the book to return. If not specified, will return both.
side.name: side

to.description: Define a specific time range for the data returned (in RFC3339 format).
to.name: to

to_event_id.description: Define a specific block range for events returned (in block_id-log_id format).
to_event_id.name: to_event_id

to_required.description: Define a specific time range for the data returned (in RFC3339 format).
to_required.name: to

type.description:
Types of events:
* order_accepted: indicates that the order has been accepted by protocol to be executed.
* order_rejected: indicates that the order was not accepted, typically due to an issue such as insufficient funds or pricing errors, with a specific reason provided.
* order_posted: marks the posting of an order to the order book, waiting for potential execution.
* order_filled: denotes that the order has been executed, either partially or in full, detailing the quantity filled and whether the order acted as a taker or maker.
* order_reduced: reflects a reduction in the order's size by user, detailing how much of the order's original quantity has been decreased.
* order_canceled: reflects a cancelation of the order by user.
* order_terminated: signals the complete cancellation of an order by protocol, typically to prevent potential liquidation or due to market closure.
* order_expired: reflects a cancelation of the order by protocol, when contract is settled.
* order_cancel_rejected: reflects a failure of order cancellation
* order_cancel_rejected: reflects a failure of order reduction

contract.description: The symbol or numeric ID of the contract for which the order is being placed.

customer_order_id.description:
A unique identifier for the order provided by the API customer. 
This ID must be unique to prevent duplication.

limit_price.description: (Optional) The limit price for the order, applicable only if the order type is limit.

quantity_contracts.description: The size of the order in terms of contracts. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

quantity_steps.description: The size of the order expressed in the smallest tradable increments, always an integer. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

type.description: Specifies the type of order, such as limit or market"

OrderSide.description: Indicates the side of the order, either buy or sell.

equity.description: The total equity of the account, calculated as the sum of collateral balance and unrealized profit

positions_required_margin.description: The margin required to maintain all open positions

unrealized_profit.description: The current unrealized profit or loss from open positions

liquidation_price.description: Estimated price at which position will be liquidated.

net_value.description: The current net value of the position.

size_assets.description: The total quote currency amount of the contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.

size_contracts.description: The total number of contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.

size_steps.description: The number of steps of the contract held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.

unrealized_profit.description: The current unrealized profit or loss from the position versus the Mark price.

warning.description: A warning message occurred during the calculation

type.description:
Types of events:
* position_opened: Marks the creation of a new position in a specific contract.
* position_increased: Reflects the addition of contracts to an existing position, increasing the position's size.
* position_decreased: Represents the reduction of contracts from a position, decreasing the position's size.
* position_closed: Indicates the complete closure of an existing position.
* position_settled: Marks the closure of a position as associated contract is settled.
* position_liquidated: Indicates forced closure of a position due to margin requirements not being met.
* position_deleveraged: Describes forced reduction of a position size to decrease risk exposure.

balance.description: Balance will not be presented in rpc response. This field is used for event processing, indicating resulting balance after the transaction execute that leads to balance update.

created_at.description: The timestamp in RFC3339 format indicating when the order was created.

type.description:
Types of events:
* deposit: Funds are added to the account.
* withdraw: Funds are withdrawn from the account.
* realized_profit: Net profits or losses realized from trading activities (can be negative).
* trading_fee: Fees paid for trading operations.
* operational_fee: Fees paid for services on the platform.
* premium: Paid for trusted mode transactions.
* default_coverage
* liquidation_fee: Fees for position liquidation
* settlement_fee: Fees for position settling

master.description: Whether the wallet is the master wallet of the platform.

current.description: Whether the session is the same as the one making the request

key.description: Returned only once when you create a new session.

get.description: Retrieve trusted wallets and secondary keys associated with an account.

get.summary: Get user from circle by id

post.description:
This endpoint is designed to bind a mobile device to a user wallet to receive push notifications generated by `CVEX` solution.
Client app must retrieve `FCM` registration token using `SDK` and send it to this endpoint. Response will contain `device_id`
which must be stored in the app and be added to the request payload to update the device token.

delete.description: Removes a favorite for the specified user based on either contract ID or index ID.

parameters.description: The ID of the contract to remove (required if in pro mode).
parameters.name: contract_id

parameters.description: The ID of the index to remove (required if in simple mode).
parameters.name: index_id

get.description: Retrieves a list of favorites for the specified user.

post.description: Adds a new favorite for the specified user. Depending on the mode, either a contract ID or an index ID must be provided.

get.description:
This endpoint provides a major platform updates.
Types of events:
* index_created
* contract_created
* contract_updated
* contract_settled

Retrieves a list of futures contracts on the platform.
Both the numerical IDs and the ticker names of the indices are permanently unique.
By default, only active contracts are returned, meaning they are currently available for trading. 
To retrieve other contracts, set the query parameter settled=true or pending=true.
Price precision defines the smallest division of price that can be reported.
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API token.

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' (default) or 'false'. When set to 'true', results include active contracts, 
meaning they are available for trading.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' or 'false' (default). 
When set to 'true', results include contracts that are already with status settlement_started.
parameters.name: settlement_started

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' or 'false' (default). 
When set to 'true', results include contracts that are already settled.
parameters.name: settled

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' or 'false' (default). 
When set to 'true', results include pending contracts scheduled to be available for trading at a future date.
parameters.name: pending

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific contract on the platform. 
Each contract is uniquely identified by either its numerical ID or ticker name.
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API token.

This endpoint returns historical ask price of contract formatted as candlesticks. 
By default, returns latest 100 data points.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.

This endpoint returns historical bid price of contract formatted as candlesticks. 
By default, returns latest 100 data points.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.

This endpoint provides a list of the most recent trades executed for a specific contract on the platform.
Each set of 100 returned trades costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 1'000.

This endpoint returns historical mark price of contract formatted as candlesticks. 
By default, returns latest 100 data points.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.

This endpoint provides the current state of the order book for a specified contract on the platform.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.

This endpoint returns historical price of contract. 
By default, returns latest 100 data points.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.

Retrieves a list of indices available on the platform.
Each index represents an underlying asset to which each contract is connected. Both the numerical IDs and the ticker names of the indices are permanently unique.
By default, only active indices are returned, meaning they are associated with at least one currently active contract. To retrieve all indices, 
including those that are not currently active, add the query parameter inactive=true.
Price precision defines the smallest division of price that can be reported, which is important for accurate trading and valuation.
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API token.

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' (default) or 'false'. When set to 'true', results include indices that are currently active, 
meaning they are associated with at least one active contract.
parameters.name: active

parameters.description:
Accepts 'true' or 'false' (default). When set to 'true', results include indices that are not active anymore, 
meaning they are not associated with at least one active contract.
parameters.name: inactive

get.description:
Retrieves detailed information about a specific index on the platform.
Each index is uniquely identified by either its numerical ID or ticker name.
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API token.

This endpoint returns historical price of index formatted as candlesticks. 
By default, returns latest 100 data points.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API token, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of data points that can be returned in a single request is 10,000.
Get notification for user

parameters.description: The mode of notifications to see
parameters.name: mode

parameters.description: The number of items per page
parameters.name: count

post.description: Mark notifications as read by id or all at once
post.summary: Mark notifications as read by id or all at once

get.description:
This endpoint provides a list of events associated with account's orders.
Types of events:
* order_accepted: indicates that the order has been accepted by protocol to be executed.
* order_rejected: indicates that the order was not accepted, typically due to an issue such as insufficient funds or pricing errors, with a specific reason provided.
* order_posted: marks the posting of an order to the order book, waiting for potential execution.
* order_filled: denotes that the order has been executed, either partially or in full, detailing the quantity filled and whether the order acted as a taker or maker.
* order_reduced: reflects a reduction in the order's size by user, detailing how much of the order's original quantity has been decreased.
* order_canceled: reflects a cancelation of the order by user.
* order_terminated: signals the complete cancellation of an order by protocol, typically to prevent potential liquidation or due to market closure.

This endpoint provides a detailed list of events related to changes in a account's trading positions on the platform.
Types of events:
* position_opened: Marks the creation of a new position in a specific contract.
* position_increased: Reflects the addition of contracts to an existing position, increasing the position's size.
* position_decreased: Represents the reduction of contracts from a position, decreasing the position's size.
* position_closed: Indicates the complete closure of an existing position.
* position_settled: Marks the closure of a position as associated contract is settled.
* position_liquidated: Indicates forced closure of a position due to margin requirements not being met.
* position_deleveraged: Describes forced reduction of a position size to decrease risk exposure.
Each set of 100 returned events costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. The maximum number of events that can be returned in a single request is 1'000.

This endpoint provides a detailed transaction history for a user's account, encompassing all financial movements such as deposits, withdrawals, profits, and fees:
Types of events:
* deposit: Funds are added to the account.
* withdraw: Funds are withdrawn from the account.
* realized_profit: Net profits or losses realized from trading activities (can be negative).
* trading_fee: Fees paid for trading operations.
* operational_fee: Fees paid for services on the platform.
* premium: Paid for trusted mode transactions.
Each set of 100 returned events costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up. 
The maximum number of events that can be returned in a single request is 1'000.

This endpoint provides an overview of all opened limit orders for an account on the platform:
* id: The unique numeric order ID assigned by the platform.
* customer_order_id: An arbitrary string identifier assigned by the API customer at the moment of order creation.
* contract_id: The symbol of the contract associated with the order.
* limit_price: The price limit set for the order.
* time_in_force: Specifies the conditions under which the order remains valid.
* reduce_only: A boolean flag that indicates whether the order is intended to only reduce a position, not increase it.
* opened_quantity_steps: The number of steps currently opened
* opened_quantity_contracts: The number of contracts currently opened
* opened_quantity_asset: The total quote amount currently opened.
  - reduced_quantity_steps
  - reduced_quantity_contracts
  - reduced_quantity_asset
* filled_quantity_steps: The number of steps that have been filled.
* filled_quantity_contracts: The number of contracts that have been filled.
* filled_quantity_asset: The total quote amount that has been filled.
* created_at: The timestamp in RFC3339 format indicating when the order was created.
* updated_at: The timestamp in RFC3339 format indicating the last modification to the order.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up.

This endpoint offers a detailed view of order held in an account specified by id or customer_order_id:
* id: The unique numeric order ID assigned by the platform.
* customer_order_id: An arbitrary string identifier assigned by the API customer at the moment of order creation.
* contract_id: The symbol of the contract associated with the order.
* limit_price: The price limit set for the order.
* time_in_force: Specifies the conditions under which the order remains valid.
* reduce_only: A boolean flag that indicates whether the order is intended to only reduce a position, not increase it.
* opened_quantity_steps: The number of steps currently opened
* opened_quantity_contracts: The number of contracts currently opened
* opened_quantity_asset: The total quote amount currently opened.
  - reduced_quantity_steps
  - reduced_quantity_contracts
  - reduced_quantity_asset
* filled_quantity_steps: The number of steps that have been filled.
* filled_quantity_contracts: The number of contracts that have been filled.
* filled_quantity_asset: The total quote amount that has been filled.
* created_at: The timestamp in RFC3339 format indicating when the order was created.
* updated_at: The timestamp in RFC3339 format indicating the last modification to the order.
Each set of 100 returned data points costs 1 API credit, with costs rounding up.

This endpoint provides detailed information about a account's trading portfolio on the platform:
* id: The Ethereum address associated with the portfolio.
* collateral_balance: The total amount of collateral held in the account.
* unrealized_profit: The current unrealized profit or loss from open positions.
* equity: The total equity of the account, calculated as the sum of collateral balance and unrealized profit.
* required_margin: The margin required to maintain all open positions.
* available_to_withdraw: The amount available for withdrawal, considering current margin requirements.
* margin_utilization: The fraction of equity being used as margin, represented as a fraction from 0 to 1.
* liquidation_risk_1d: The estimated risk of liquidation within the next day, represented as a fraction from 0 to 1.
* leverage: The current leverage of the account, calculated as the ratio of equity to required margin.
* warning: Since complex calculations are involved, the data returned by this endpoint may be imprecise. Warning messages are provided to indicate potential issues and a fulfill explanation. 
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API credit.

This endpoint offers a detailed view of all positions held in an account:
* contract: The symbol of the contract, represented as a string.
* quantity_contracts: The total number of contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* quantity_steps: The number of steps of the contract held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* quantity_assets: The total quote currency amount of the contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* net_value: The current net value of the position.
* average_entry_price: The price at which the position was entered.
* liquidation_price: Estimated price at which position will be liquidated.
* unrealized_profit: The current unrealized profit or loss from the position versus the Mark price.
* deleverage_rank: The ranking of the position for deleveraging in the event of liquidation, represented as a fraction from 0 to 1.
* warning: Since complex calculations are involved, the data returned by this endpoint may be imprecise. Warning messages are provided to indicate potential issues and a fulfill explanation. 
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API credit.

This endpoint offers a detailed view of position held in an account specified by contract id or symbol:
* contract: The symbol of the contract, represented as a string.
* quantity_contracts: The total number of contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* quantity_steps: The number of steps of the contract held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* quantity_assets: The total quote currency amount of the contracts held. Positive for longs, negative for shorts.
* net_value: The current net value of the position.
* average_entry_price: The price at which the position was entered.
* liquidation_price: Estimated price at which position will be liquidated.
* unrealized_profit: The current unrealized profit or loss from the position versus the Mark price.
* deleverage_rank: The ranking of the position for deleveraging in the event of liquidation, represented as a fraction from 0 to 1.
Each request to this endpoint costs 1 API credit.

get.summary: Get details about current session or API key

delete.summary: Unassign secondary key of the session

post.summary: Assign secondary key to the session

get.description: This endpoint is designed to provide daily and total fee statistics for Defi Llama.
This endpoint is designed to provide daily and total volume statistics for Defi Llama.

post.description:
This endpoint is designed to execute a combination of orders atomically. 
If any order in the batch is rejected for any reason, all orders are simultaneously rejected. 
Please note that only one order per contract can be executed in an atomic batch.

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Body Parameters:
* customer_order_id: A unique identifier for the order provided by the API customer. This ID must be unique to prevent duplication.
* contract: The symbol or numeric ID of the contract for which the order is being placed.
* type: Specifies the type of order, such as limit or market"
* limit_price: (Optional) The limit price for the order, applicable only if the order type is limit.
* time_in_force: Defines how long the order remains valid before expiration. Options include "GTC" (Good Till Canceled), "IOC" (Immediate or Cancel), "FOK" (Fill or Kill), and "PO" (Post Only).
* reduce_only: A boolean flag indicating whether the order should only reduce a position, not increase it.
* quantity_steps: The size of the order expressed in the smallest tradable increments, always an integer. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_contracts: The size of the order in terms of contracts. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_assets: The size of the order in units of the underlying asset. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

Responses:
* 201 Created: Successfully created order details including status, order ID, transaction hash, and associated events.
* 422 Unprocessable Entity: Order was rejected by the protocol.
* 409 Conflict: A conflict occurred, typically due to an existing order with the same customer ID.

This endpoint is designed to execute a batch of actions optimistically. 
If any action in the batch fails, the remaining actions will still be executed. 
Below is a list of the supported actions:
* create_order
* reduce_order
* replace_order
* cancel_order
* atomic_orders

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

This endpoint is designed to calculate premium for the CCTP deposit quasi tx.
It takes into consideration account existence before calculating.  

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully calculated premium.
* 403 Forbidden: Wrong parameters in request.
post.summary: Calculate premium for CCTP deposit quasi tx

post.description:
This endpoint is designed to calculate premium for the meta tx. 

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully calculated premium.
* 403 Forbidden: Wrong parameters in request.

This endpoint is designed to handle the cancellation of all orders. 
If any order can no longer be cancelled (for example, if it has already been executed or previously cancelled), the request will not fail.

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully reduced order.
* 404 Not Found: An order with provided id not found.

This endpoint is designed to handle the cancellation of orders. 
If the order can no longer be cancelled (for example, if it has already been executed or previously cancelled), the request will fail.

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Body Parameters:
* id: Numeric id or customer id of the order.

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully reduced order.
* 404 Not Found: An order with provided id not found.

This endpoint is designed to handle the closing of all orders and positions. 

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully reduced order.
* 404 Not Found: An order with provided id not found.

This endpoint is allow to create orders to using CVEX API. The endpoint requires the submission of necessary headers for authentication and the provision of detailed order parameters within the request body.

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Body Parameters:
* customer_order_id: A unique identifier for the order provided by the API customer. This ID must be unique to prevent duplication.
* contract: The symbol or numeric ID of the contract for which the order is being placed.
* type: Specifies the type of order, such as limit or market"
* limit_price: (Optional) The limit price for the order, applicable only if the order type is limit.
* time_in_force: Defines how long the order remains valid before expiration. Options include "GTC" (Good Till Canceled), "IOC" (Immediate or Cancel), "FOK" (Fill or Kill), and "PO" (Post Only).
* reduce_only: A boolean flag indicating whether the order should only reduce a position, not increase it.
* quantity_steps: The size of the order expressed in the smallest tradable increments, always an integer. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_contracts: The size of the order in terms of contracts. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_assets: The size of the order in units of the underlying asset. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

Responses:
* 201 Created: Successfully created order details including status, order ID, transaction hash, and associated events.
* 422 Unprocessable Entity: Order was rejected by the protocol.
* 409 Conflict: A conflict occurred, typically due to an existing order with the same customer ID.

This endpoint is designed to reduce the size of an existing order via the CVEX API. Unlike replacing an order with a new one, 
reducing an order allows it to maintain its position in the order book at the same price level. Only a decrease in order size is permitted with this method.

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Body Parameters:
* id: Numeric id or customer id of the order.
* quantity_steps: The size of the order expressed in the smallest tradable increments, always an integer. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_contracts: The size of the order in terms of contracts. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_assets: The size of the order in units of the underlying asset. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully reduced order.
* 404 Not Found: An order with provided id not found.

This endpoint is designed to replace an existing limit order with a new one while preserving the numeric order ID and customer order ID. 
The method will fail if the limit order no longer exists in the order book (e.g., if it has been cancelled, filled, etc.).

Required Request Headers:
X-Signature: The required digital signature of the request.

Body Parameters:
* id: Numeric id or customer id of the order.
* type: Specifies the type of order, such as limit or market"
* limit_price: The limit price for the order.
* quantity_steps: The size of the order expressed in the smallest tradable increments, always an integer. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_contracts: The size of the order in terms of contracts. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.
* quantity_assets: The size of the order in units of the underlying asset. Only one quantity parameter should be provided.

Responses:
* 200 OK: Successfully reduced order.
* 404 Not Found: An order with provided id not found.

get.description: This endpoint provides a platform-api version.
